title: The Simple Gift
author: Steven Herrick
metaDescription: Parent curriculum guide for The Simple Gift. See what your child will learn week by week.
outcomes: Connecting textual analysis to broader themes

weeks.title: Understanding the Text
weeks.description: Building foundational understanding of the text's world
topics: Introduction to The Simple Gift and its historical/social context
Understanding the setting, time period, and cultural background
Meeting the key characters and their initial situations
Identifying the narrative voice and point of view

weeks.title: How the Text Works
topics: Exploring the central pattern: Vulnerability Exchange Patterning
Understanding how the narrative structure creates meaning
Recognising recurring motifs and their significance

weeks.title: Analysing Key Techniques
weeks.description: Learning to identify and analyse Herrick's literary techniques
topics: Collecting textual evidence for each technique

weeks.title: Building the Argument
weeks.description: Developing a thesis and analytical argument
topics: Exploring the guiding question: How does Herrick craft the pattern of vulnerability exchange patterning to shape readers' understanding?

weeks.title: Writing the Introduction
topics: Drafting and refining the introduction paragraph

weeks.title: Body Paragraph 1
topics: Analysing the technique's effect on meaning

technique.name: Internal Monologue
technique.description: The character's private thoughts reveal their psychological journey, showing how they process experiences and grow through reflection.

weeks.title: Body Paragraph 2
topics: Building on analytical skills from Week 6

technique.name: Imagery
technique.description: Vivid sensory details create emotional resonance, helping readers experience the text's world and themes viscerally.

technique.name: Motif
technique.description: Recurring elements create patterns of meaning that develop and deepen throughout the text.
